unnormalised: ## My Data Pack is Crying: A Hilarious Look at Music Streaming in India
normalised: ## My Data Pack is Crying: A Hilarious Look at Music Streaming in India

unnormalised: Arrey yaar, remember the days of painstakingly downloading songs from shady websites? You’d wait 2 hours for one grainy MP3 of "Chaiyya Chaiyya" (because clearly, no Bollywood party is complete without it), only to discover it was a Rick Astley rickroll in disguise. *shudders*. Those were dark times, my friends, dark times.
normalised: Arrey yaar, remember the days of painstakingly downloading songs from shady websites? You’d wait two hours for one grainy M P three of "Chaiyya Chaiyya" (because clearly, no Bollywood party is complete without it), only to discover it was a Rick Astley rickroll in disguise. *shudders*. Those were dark times, my friends, dark times.

unnormalised: Now, thanks to the wonders of music streaming, we have access to practically every song ever written, right at our fingertips. Sounds idyllic, right? Wrong. My data pack is currently staging a dharna because I’ve been streaming Armaan Malik's entire discography on loop since, well, since Armaan Malik released his entire discography.
normalised: Now, thanks to the wonders of music streaming, we have access to practically every song ever written, right at our fingertips. Sounds idyllic, right? Wrong. My data pack is currently staging a dharna because I’ve been streaming Armaan Malik's entire discography on loop since, well, since Armaan Malik released his entire discography.

unnormalised: See, the problem isn't the music. The problem is the *temptation*. Back in the CD era (remember those shiny discs, kids?), you were limited. You owned, like, 10 CDs. Now, you can access millions! It's like having a buffet of biryani and being on a diet. It's cruel, I tell you!
normalised: See, the problem isn't the music. The problem is the *temptation*. Back in the C D era (remember those shiny discs, kids?), you were limited. You owned, like, ten C D s. Now, you can access millions! It's like having a buffet of biryani and being on a diet. It's cruel, I tell you!

unnormalised: Just the other day, I was at my cousin Priya's wedding in Delhi. Instead of participating in the "Sangeet" and awkwardly dancing to "London Thumakda," I was hiding in a corner, battling with my Spotify algorithm. It kept suggesting English songs! As if I wanted to hear Ed Sheeran while the dhol was beating! This is India, Spotify! Play some Badshah, for crying out loud!
normalised: Just the other day, I was at my cousin Priya's wedding in Delhi. Instead of participating in the "Sangeet" and awkwardly dancing to "London Thumakda," I was hiding in a corner, battling with my Spotify algorithm. It kept suggesting English songs! As if I wanted to hear Ed Sheeran while the dhol was beating! This is India, Spotify! Play some Badshah, for crying out loud!

unnormalised: My phone bill is now higher than the tuition fees at IIM Ahmedabad (okay, maybe that's an exaggeration, but it *feels* like it). I'm seriously considering starting a GoFundMe: "Help Ravi Keep Streaming Without Starving."
normalised: My phone bill is now higher than the tuition fees at I I M Ahmedabad (okay, maybe that's an exaggeration, but it *feels* like it). I'm seriously considering starting a GoFundMe: "Help Ravi Keep Streaming Without Starving."

unnormalised: And don’t even get me started on those “Discover Weekly” playlists. Sometimes they’re surprisingly good, sometimes they suggest songs so obscure they sound like someone recorded their cat fighting a vacuum cleaner. But hey, at least it's something new to complain about! So, keep streaming, my friends, but maybe keep an eye on that data usage. Or, you know, just blame Airtel. Everyone else does.
normalised: And don’t even get me started on those “Discover Weekly” playlists. Sometimes they’re surprisingly good, sometimes they suggest songs so obscure they sound like someone recorded their cat fighting a vacuum cleaner. But hey, at least it's something new to complain about! So, keep streaming, my friends, but maybe keep an eye on that data usage. Or, you know, just blame Airtel. Everyone else does.
